description: The cluster dashboard displays the latest configurations, resources status and usages percent of the clusters entities.

panels.content: ###### The cluster dashboard displays the latest configurations, resources status and usage percent of the clusters entities.

panels.description: Number of hosts in the cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-1 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

-- This query returns the number of active hosts in a chosen cluster
SELECT
    COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id ) AS host_count
FROM 
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
            )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Number of Hosts (EX03-1)

panels.description: Number of virtual machines in the cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-2 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

-- This query returns the number of active vms in a chosen cluster
SELECT
    COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
FROM 
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
            )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Number of Virtual Machines (EX03-2)

panels.description: Average uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-3 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Cluster Host Uptime (EX03-3)

panels.description: Average percentage of CPU usage for all hosts in the selected cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-4 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    cpu_usage_percent_avg AS average_cpu_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active hosts
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    ) AS average_cpu_percent

panels.title: Cluster Host CPU Usage (EX03-4)

panels.description: Average percentage of memory usage for all hosts in the selected cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-5 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    memory_usage_percent_avg AS average_memory_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active hosts
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    ) AS average_memory_percent

panels.title: Cluster Host Memory Usage (EX03-5)

panels.description: Uptime percent of high availability virtual machines.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-6 - This query returns the
-- uptime percent of high availability vms
-- for the specific cluster

SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time    
        SUM 
            (
                v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Cluster High Availability Virtual Machine Uptime (EX03-6)

panels.description: Average CPU and memory peaks per host for the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-7 - This query returns the
-- average cpu and memory peaks per host
-- for the specific cluster

SELECT
    'No' AS is_deleted,
    host_id,
    host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_peak ) AS avg_cpu_peak,
    AVG ( mem_peak ) AS avg_mem_peak
FROM 
    (
        -- Calculation of samples cpu and memory usage peaks
        SELECT
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
            MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_peak,
            MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS mem_peak
        FROM 
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active hosts only
            v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            AND v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
            DATE_TRUNC ( 'hour', v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime )
    ) AS tbl_samples_peaks
GROUP BY host_id, host_name

panels.title: Cluster Summary of Host Resource Peaks (EX03-7)

panels.description: CPU and memory usage for the top 5 busiest hosts.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-8 - This query returns the
-- cpu and memory usage for the
-- top 5 busiest hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    'No' AS is_deleted,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_max,
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_max
FROM 
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) 
    DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Cluster Top 5 Busiest Hosts (EX03-8)

panels.description: Average number of CPU's for the active hosts and virtual machines in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-9 - This query returns the
-- total number of CPU's for the hosts and vms 
-- in the specific cluster.

-- total hosts number of CPUs
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total Hosts Number of CPUs' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.cpu_cores ) AS cpu_cores_hosts
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            a.host_id,
            -- Calculation of host number of CPUs 
            CASE
                WHEN count_threads_as_cores = TRUE
                    THEN COALESCE ( a.number_of_threads, 0 )
                ELSE COALESCE ( a.number_of_cores, 0 )
            END AS cpu_cores
        FROM 
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
            INNER JOIN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS b 
                ON 
                    (
                        a.history_id =
                        b.host_configuration_version
                        AND b.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY host_id
                                )
                        -- Here we get only active hosts
                        AND b.host_status = 1
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        a.cluster_id =
                        v4_5_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY a.host_id, count_threads_as_cores, number_of_cores, number_of_threads
    ) AS nested_query

-- EX03-9 - This query returns the
-- total number of CPU's for the hosts and vms 
-- in the specific cluster.

-- total vms number of CPUs
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total vms Number of CPUs' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.cpu_cores ) AS cpu_cores_vms
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            a.vm_id,
            -- Calculation of vm number of CPUs 
            (
                COALESCE ( a.cpu_per_socket, 0 )
                *
                COALESCE ( a.number_of_sockets, 0 ) 
            ) AS cpu_cores
        FROM 
            v4_5_latest_configuration_vms AS a
            INNER JOIN v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS b 
                ON 
                    (
                        a.history_id =
                        b.vm_configuration_version
                        AND b.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY vm_id
                                )
                        -- Here we get only active vms
                        AND b.vm_status = 1
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY a.vm_id, cpu_per_socket, number_of_sockets
    ) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine CPU Overcommit (EX03-9)

panels.description: Average memory for the active hosts and virtual machines in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-10 - This query returns the
-- total memory size for the hosts and vms 
-- in the specific cluster.

-- total hosts memory size
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total Hosts Memory' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.memory ) AS memory_hosts
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            a.host_id,
            -- Calculation of host memory
            CAST ( COALESCE ( a.memory_size_mb, 0 ) AS float ) / 1024 AS memory
        FROM 
            v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
            INNER JOIN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS b 
                ON 
                    (
                        a.history_id =
                        b.host_configuration_version
                        AND b.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY host_id
                                )
                        -- Here we get only active hosts
                        AND b.host_status = 1
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY a.host_id, memory_size_mb
    ) AS nested_query

-- EX03-10 - This query returns the
-- total memory size for the hosts and vms 
-- in the specific cluster.

-- total vms memory size
SELECT
    NOW () AS time,
    'Total vms Memory' AS entity,
    SUM ( nested_query.memory ) AS memory_vms
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            a.vm_id,
            -- Calculation of vm memory
            CAST ( COALESCE ( a.memory_size_mb, 0 ) AS float ) / 1024 AS memory
        FROM 
            v4_5_latest_configuration_vms AS a
            INNER JOIN v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS b 
                ON 
                    (
                        a.history_id =
                        b.vm_configuration_version
                        AND b.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY vm_id
                                )
                        -- Here we get only active vms
                        AND b.vm_status = 1
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
            a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
        GROUP BY a.vm_id, memory_size_mb
    ) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine Memory Overcommit (EX03-10)

panels.description: This report displays the total uptime and planned downtime percentage for the 5 high availability virtual machines that have the lowest uptime.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-11 - This query returns for 5 high availability vms,
-- that have the least uptime percent,
-- the total uptime and planned downtime percent per vm.

SELECT
    'No' AS is_deleted,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id, 
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples vm uptime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples vm planned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status IN ( 0, 2 )
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS planned_downtime_percent
FROM 
    v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
                v4_5_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    AND v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
GROUP BY
    -- For the calculations to be per vm 
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name
ORDER BY uptime_percent ASC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five High Availability Virtual Machines Downtime (EX03-11)

panels.description: This report displays the total uptime and planned and unplanned downtime percentage for the 5 hosts that have the lowest uptime.

targets.rawSql:
-- EX03-12 - This query returns for 5 hosts,
-- that have the least uptime percent, 
-- the total uptime, planned and unplanned 
-- downtime percent per host.

SELECT
    'No' AS is_deleted,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host uptime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host planned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 2
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        / SUM ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS planned_downtime_percent,
    (
        -- Calculation of samples host unplanned downtime 
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 3
                        THEN COALESCE ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        SUM ( v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status )
    ) * 100 AS unplanned_downtime_percent
FROM 
    v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_5_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    -- For the calculations to be per host
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_5_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    uptime_percent ASC,
    unplanned_downtime_percent DESC,
    planned_downtime_percent DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five Hosts Downtime (EX03-12)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT
    datacenter_name AS __text, 
    datacenter_id AS __value
FROM v4_5_latest_configuration_datacenters
